snippet: Leaders of a group of retired Detroit workers have agreed to accept pension cuts, officials said Friday.
abstract: Leaders of Detroit Retired City Employees Association, representing nearly 8,000 municipal retirees, agree to cuts of 4.5 percent to retirees’ pension benefits, latest in settlements secured by city in its efforts to emerge from bankruptcy; cuts are smaller than city had initially proposed.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of a group of retired Detroit workers have agreed to accept pension cuts, officials said Friday.
